head.title: Third Youth Is Arrested in Series of Queens Attacks

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Third Youth Is Arrested in Series of Queens Attacks
hedline.hl2: Third Youth Is Arrested in Series of Queens Attacks

abstract.p: Herman Gonzalez is charged with two counts of robbery in connection with series of crimes in Flushing-Meadows-Corona Park in Queens; has been linked by police to Belter Yovanni Gubara Rivera and Marcos Polanco, who police say confessed to attacking and robbing several people in park between Nov 22 and Dec 25; Rivera has also been charged in murder of Carlos Flores (M)

block.p: A third youth has been arrested in connection with a series of vicious crimes in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens that left one man dead and another in a coma, the police said yesterday.
The suspect, Herman Gonzalez, 19, of Van Cleef Street, just west of the park, was arrested Friday and charged with two counts of second-degree robbery, the police said.
A third youth has been arrested in connection with a series of vicious crimes in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens that left one man dead and another in a coma, the police said yesterday.
A third youth has been arrested in connection with a series of vicious crimes in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park in Queens that left one man dead and another in a coma, the police said yesterday.
The suspect, Herman Gonzalez, 19, of Van Cleef Street, just west of the park, was arrested Friday and charged with two counts of second-degree robbery, the police said.
It was not immediately clear what role Mr. Gonzalez might have played in the crimes that the police say linked him to the two other suspects, Belter Yovanni Gubara Rivera and Marcos Polanco, both 17.

But a law enforcement official said that on Nov. 20, he attacked a 20-year-old man delivering food on a bicycle. The man was punched and kicked, and the robber stole $200 and his cellphone, the official said, adding that Mr. Gonzalez had confessed.

The police said Mr. Rivera and Mr. Polanco both confessed to attacking and robbing several people in the park between Nov. 22 and Dec. 25. They were being held without bail. One victim, Jae Woo Park, 36, of Little Neck, was severely beaten on Dec. 25 and was still unconscious.
Mr. Rivera was also charged with murder in the death of Carlos Flores, 40, whose lacerated body was found in one of the park's ponds on Dec. 5.
